title: A Bodyguard for a Politician's Family Gets in Trouble with Drugs
summary: A man named Justin Salsburey worked as a bodyguard for Vivek Ramaswamy's family. Vivek is a politician running for governor in Ohio. Justin was arrested for drug trafficking, which means he is accused of sending illegal drugs through the mail. His wife, Ruthann Rankin, was also charged. The family hired a private security company to protect them, and that company fired Justin right away when they found out. The family says they are very worried and want justice if the charges are true. Justin had passed background checks and drug tests before getting the job. The drugs were fake pills sent to their home in Ohio.

background_read: This article is about a bodyguard for a politician's family who got into legal trouble. In the United States, drug trafficking is a serious crime where people are accused of selling or moving illegal drugs. Politicians often hire private companies to protect their families from harm. Background checks are tests to see if someone has a good history before they get a job. When someone is arrested, it means the police think they broke the law, and they might go to jail if found guilty. This story shows how even people in trusted jobs can face problems, and it's important for families to stay safe.
Article_Structure: WHO: Justin Salsburey, a bodyguard for Vivek Ramaswamy's family, and his wife Ruthann Rankin
WHAT: They were arrested for drug trafficking, accused of sending fake pills through the mail
WHERE: In Ohio, at their home and in Columbus where Justin is held in jail
WHY: Because they are suspected of illegal drug activities, which alarmed the family who hired them for protection
